website_summaries.verdict: Adult sleeping bag for camping in temperatures as low as 30 degrees Fahrenheit. Good for those up to 6-feet 4-inches.
pros: Brushed polyester cover with cozy liner
ColeTherm insulation keeps you comfortable throughout the night
Has nice cotton lining to keep you warm yet breathable
Extremely comfortable and wide enough to turn around in without getting tangled
Looks good after first wash and fits in front loader washer-dryer
cons: hard to get it into a tight roll
Inside is a little rough, as fabric is similar to a fire retardant type of material

customer_reviews.title: Certainly not 84 inches
customer_reviews.text: Too short. Not 84 inches as advertised. Mine was 80 inches at best. Would be shorter if measured from the inside because the zipper would probably stop it an inch short of the overall length.
customer_reviews.author: ruchi

customer_reviews.title: of which by the way was super easy to do
customer_reviews.text: We were Cabin Camping, so that's the extent to which I can provide an honest review. The first night we were in upper 40's, both myself and my son were almost sweating in the sleeping bag's, needing to open the zipper, of which by the way was super easy to do. Exit fold up was super duper simple. They are rather heavyweight, but again I was cabin camping. I feel like I got extremely lucky with selecting these two bags. I could not have written a better outcome in terms of our experience with the Coleman White Water Adult Sleeping Bag. 5 Thumbs UP. BUY, BUY, BUY is my personal recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: VigorGS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I am a heavy set woman and was looking for a bag I had plenty of space to move around in and would be warm enough for tent camping in the spring and fall. This bag is perfect for this use.. I love that the end side is smooth enough that my fleece pajamas don't stick to it. The inside fabric seems to be a cotton/flannel blend which is very comfortable. I highly recommend this bag to anyone looking for a quality bag in a large size at a great price. It is bulky and heavy though so I would not recommend it for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: JennyAnn

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is exactly what I was looking for. Big and roomy! The only downside is that the sleeping bag shell is dark green in color instead of the silver/grey color as described and pictured on the box. I like the cotton lining but it doesn't feel like flannel as described. Honestly, I would have preferred the color pictured but the quality overrides the aesthetic. I'm wondering if anyone else received the the dark green color shell as I've not seen any indication of this happening in any of the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: BridgetV

customer_reviews.title: Beware if color matters!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a gift and thought the gray/blue color would be perfect for the recipient. I received a very dark green. Also, I don't think it had the scoop to accommodate a pillow. I didn't unwrap it to see because I knew I would have to return it. Problem is I still need a sleeping bag. It is so frustrating when the description doesn't match the product!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Stice

customer_reviews.title: A Boomers sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I have been a year-round camper for almost 50 years. I've used cotton bags, down bags, polyester bags, hollow synthetic bags, all of which will work. But as I have gotten a bit older and comfort in any sleeping position is important to me I found that this bag, because of it roomy design features, allows me a perfect sleep outdoors. I can control the amount of warmth in the bag and it does not shove zippers or seams into your face as you sleep. It is my perfect 3 season bag.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: was 31 degrees and I stayed warm and comfortable (but did have a wool hat on)
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag for the last 2 years, fall camping in Northern Minnesota. Coldest morning temp. was 31 degrees and I stayed warm and comfortable (but did have a wool hat on). I'm 5"8" and there is plenty of room for my 25 lb dog curled up at my feet. It is easy to fold or roll up but is very bulky. Definitely designed for car camping, not backpacking or kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: PAM R

customer_reviews.title: Warm and durable.
customer_reviews.text: My girls (14 and 9) take these to camp in the Adirondaks in early July, so it's still pretty cold there at night. They came back telling me they didn't freeze this year! They were warm and cozy with plenty of leg room. They especially liked that the pillow end of the bag is a bit longer for their pillow. My only complaint is the tie up line is a bit complex, but once i got a degree in sleeping bag engineering, I figured it out! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: N. Schinman

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this sleeping bag! I purchased one a few years ago and loved it but then lost it in a move. I purchased the same one for a second time and it is just as great. The inside is soft, it is warm enough for 50s (I haven’t tried it in the 40s) and it is big enough to give some room to toss and turn a little. The inside is cotton which is so much better than the hot and sweaty polyester linings. Really recommend this bag even for someone not “big and tall”!
customer_reviews.author: Racael E Neenan

customer_reviews.title: ... bags camping just this past weekend and we truly love them! At night it got down into the ...
customer_reviews.text: We took these sleeping bags camping just this past weekend and we truly love them! At night it got down into the low 60s, maybe high 50s and we were kept so comfortably warm and snug. We live in the Florida Keys, so when temps drop into the 70s, we think we're going to freeze -- ha!! These sleeping bags took up little room while packing up my small car, giving them an added bonus in my world. I find them to be easy to roll back up into their small, compact package, and then toss back into the trunk. I don't know how many times over the three-day weekend that we said, "Man, I really love these sleeping bags!"
customer_reviews.author: Tina R.

customer_reviews.title: Size not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping Bags are advertised as 'Adult Size" measuring 33x75 inches. Product arrived as "Big and Tall Size" measuring 39x84 inches. Returned them and ordered again....Big and Tall size bags were shipped to us again. Finally ordered these sleeping bags directly from Coleman, who's web site also showed the adult size as 33x75. Same thing happened. Contacted Coleman directly and and was told that this sleeping bag only comes in Big and Tall size, despite the description. Nice sleeping bag if you want the extra room, otherwise, not the size advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Fuller

customer_reviews.title: I am a pretty big girl (size 20) and I was comfortable in ...
customer_reviews.text: My friends and I had the wild idea of camping on the beach the beginning of February. Imagine 30 degree weather and 20-40 mph winds, followed by rain. It was COLD. I had planned ahead with 3 quilts... but it was this sleeping bag that kept me warm. My friend had quilts and she was freezing. I am a pretty big girl (size 20) and I was comfortable in this bag. Plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag, but too much of it
customer_reviews.text: I got this sleeping bag, not knowing it was for big and tall people. I'm around 6' but relatively thin and the first time I got in it it took three weeks to find my way out from the depths of its crevices. Overall, it more to carry around than what was needed, but it was comfortable and I loved the material it was made out of. I can see myself using it more if I were the size of Shaq. I tried returning it, but it would have costed almost half as much as it was worth, so now I'm looking for someone to buy it. For now, it sits on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Aranda

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought for camping, Super heavy duty, may have to buy a lighter weight one for warmer weather. Nice zipper that doesnt get caught. Like how the bottom curves upwards for the pillow. Wish it had built in elastic to close them up. It has strings and little plastic hooks fall off easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

customer_reviews.title: Wide, breathable, perfect
customer_reviews.text: This bag arrived promptly. The inside is a little stiff at first but it softens up after use or a wash. The bag is a good width. Would work well for a larger person or brod shoulders. The best features of the bag are: Affordability Breathable fabric Zipper plow (keeps fabric out of the zipper) Interior fabric extends over the exterior fabric Soft interior fabric Wide opening I can tell this bag will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: BlK  C4t

customer_reviews.title: It could have been a nice sleeping bag without the bad liner material
customer_reviews.text: The color scheme is pleasing and decent outer material. A big problem I have with this sleeping bag is the liner which is made of crappy nylon material that's abrasive. If you have dry skin (very common in the Winter), the liner clings to your rough skin like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: M_Theory

customer_reviews.title: Great size, wish a bit higher quality interior and straps.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the inside material was a softer flannel instead of the polyester, but it's ok. The hood scoop isn't quite big enough for a full size pillow. Rest of the bag is generously sized and comfortable, though. Zippers work nicely. The cords to hold it rolled up are nearly useless. I bought a stuff sack at Dick's sporting goods and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag for claustrophobics!
customer_reviews.text: Oh! I love this sleeping bag! I am a bit claustrophobic and can't stand having my legs constrained (those mummy sleeping bags make me shudder!). This bag is SO roomy! I laid it out on my queen sized bed and it takes up a bit over half of it. I was a very happy camper this past week!
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, poor seller
customer_reviews.text: We own an identical one and love it. This one however arrived used, in a box that looked like it had been left outside in the rain for a few days. Not the actual shipping box, but the interior Coleman box. Promptly returned.
customer_reviews.author: Elle B.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is HUGE
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my ever growing teenage son. I do have to say this is one of the largest single person sleeping bags I've ever seen. It's light-weight, so the term "cool weather" is a bit of a misnomer. We took it on a summer camping trip in the mountains and the temps dropped to the mid 60's at night. This was the perfect weight for that. You'll need a stuff sack - the skinny elastic bands sewn on to hold this when rolled up are not effective at all. The Liberty Mountain Stuff Sack (X-Large/12 x 25-Inch) here on Amazon fit it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: P. DrewTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2 people (100 lbs and 150 lbs) perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is perfect! I bought it to use at a music festival and the width of the sleeping bag is large enough to fit both me and my boyfriend (100 lbs and 150 lbs). It's spacious and comfortable! However, the sleeping bag alone was not enough to keep us warm in windy and cold weather. I HIGHLY recommend buying the Space All Weather Blanket to insulate the inside of the sleeping bag ( Combining the both of them was perfect for sleeping in below 40 degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable. However
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfortable. However, the product loses a star for its claim of big and tall. I'm 6' and my feet push into the bottom while still allowing the top to go around my shoulders and maybe a little around my face. Other than that. Its an excellent sleeping bag. You'd just have to get adjusted to the feeling of the lining. It feels like its kind of rough. Imagine a really soft denim. It keeps in the heat while still managing to stay soft enough to rest comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Wish

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Bag, big and tall buyers may want to see it in person.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and roomy, great for the casual car-camper. Checks all of my personal sleeping bag boxes. The box says it's ideal for tall people, I'm only 5'9", and I bought this because I like a bit more room in my bag. Though if you're actually 6'4", you may want to head over to your local sporting goods store and see the size in person, it doesn't seem long enough to fit a 6"4' person. A quality bag, perfect for fall and spring time camping. Heavy zippers and made with a thick, plush material. Great deal for the ~$35 price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS!! I'm 5'4", avg build. I had previously used my kids sleeping bag which I fit into fine but if you leave partially unzipped so you wont get to warm and like to just pull it over you, I constantly found myself readjusting myself. I purchased this one because it was larger to go camping with my family in 45 degree weather. It was perfect and so roomy! So roomy that my 10 year old niece who needed some comfort in the middle of the night crawled in with me LOL Very warm and roomy, every adult should have one!
customer_reviews.author: Gnomey Gardens

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Best sleeping bag for my big guy! Nice size for average to large size. My husband is 5’7 and he can completely cover himself up in this sleeping bag. Plenty of room to stretch out in. If you don’t like to be confined in a sleeping bag then this is what you are looking for. Used many times and have found nothing flawed.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I actually loved this sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I actually loved this sleeping bag! I did not feel confined and I love the extra material at the top of the pillow. My camping trip was in 30 and 40 degree weather and I was plenty warm. This is not a sleeping bag for backpacking because it is bigger. My only concern with the bag is the string that are used to keep it rolled up - they do not seem durable and seem like they are going to break after awhile. There is also no bag with the sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Teal butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Summer Camping
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel of the inside of this sleeping bag. It's not that annoying flannel that most bags have. Just the right comfort for summer camping. Easy, no-stick zipper. I don't bother rolling it up. Much easier to use a stuff bag.
customer_reviews.author: Minnie

customer_reviews.title: This is so soft and comfortable. I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is so soft and comfortable. I love it!! It kept me so warm at camp where I slept basically outdoors in a valley so it got pretty cold at night. It is truly a cold weather blanket, though. I slept in it on a warm night and I overheated big time. The zipper is big and doesn't get stuck and there is a pocket for a flashlight. One of my favorite features is the extra head area you get so that your pillow doesn't separate from the sleeping bag. It is also pretty long so there's good space for legs especially since I'm tall. This is an amazing sleeping bag, a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable lining and NOT as tall as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: NOT as advertised. First of all, I'm 6'3" so when I buy a BIG AND TALL sleeping bag I expect it to be able to clear my head. Well, the lower portion of the sleeping bag didn't even clear my chin. Secondly, the inner lining is extremely uncomfortable. VERY scratchy and makes it really difficult to sleep. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Not okay with the temperature rating
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a tent on a night with temps from 50-35 degrees and was freezing in sweatpants, wool socks, wool hat and a North Face Denali fleece jacket. The size is wonderful for me at 5'9", but too short for my 6'3" husband. The quality is nice and the zipper moved very well. I will use it for summer camping, but I will be ordering a much higher quality bag for fall and spring camp outs.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Dearest

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I noticed a slight ripo on day two, but not sure i caught the zipper. I am small (5”2), but the oversized bag was great. I didn’t feel confined. And the fabric is great. Cozy, not slippery, but still allows you move without getting all tangled up.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: so comfy but needs a better way to pack up
customer_reviews.text: So warm but impossible to roll up. Sleeping bags make me feel like I'm suffocating so I wanted this to keep me from hating camping. I am only 5ft 4 and 134lbs. I also knew that I could bring one of my babies into bed with me if they woke up in the tent cold. I had a cozy comfortable night sleep. But the problem is the bag doesn't roll up. It's so huge and the straps for holding the rolled up bag together can't manage it. So the huge bag takes up a ton of room in our vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Soft, comfy and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sleeping bag!!!! Super comfy, soft and warm. Very roomy. Seems very durable. One of the best purchases I've made for camping. I'm 5'7" and plus size and this sleeping bag provided enough room to turn over easily and provided ample coverage for my shoulders. It rolls easily and there are toggles to keep it folded nicely while you roll it. The string/ rope provided for securing the roll is not real heavy duty, so I purchased a pair of sleeping bag straps for $3.99. The only thing that I wish was that there was a drawstring around the top part so that you could close the top part to keep in the warmth on cold nights.
customer_reviews.author: Revital Rabinovic

customer_reviews.title: This is a great sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great sleeping bag as I like room to move. My son (skinny 11 yr old) thinks it too wide for him. I love the extra material under the pillow because I tend to sleep with my arms under my pillow and this keeps my arms from laying on the outside ground. It also helps keep the pillow from slipping around.
customer_reviews.author: Chadburn Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but no bag
customer_reviews.text: Really nice sleeping bag but no storage bag included. It is not advertised with a bag but I think that is essential and is worth paying a little extra for. If you plan on keeping this for any sleeping bag for a long time, buy a decent storage bag. Overall Im happy and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: carlospalooza

customer_reviews.title: Buying a second one soon
customer_reviews.text: Pros - comfortable - high quality inner quilt - doesn't make too much sound - relatively easy to roll up - great price point Cons - It should have came with a warning "Spouse my trade their Sleeping Bag with you" Now I need to buy another one...
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Zou

customer_reviews.title: Worst sleeping bag I've seen/used over the past 20 years.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible sleeping bag. The zipper is an absolutely friggen disaster. I've never seen a worse zipper. Also, it just was NOT warm. At a 45-55 degree weather it was cold. I ended up returning it, and just purchasing this one instead:  (which has a normal zipper that actually works as expected)
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Nice non-mummy bag for moderate conditions
customer_reviews.text: Nice non-mummy bag for moderate conditions. Comfortable. I opted to get this non-low temp bag and add fleece blanket to it for versatility sake. Bag is bit enough to work with the blanket, (which I can have on hand for other uses like bundling up by the fire). In our initial use we didn't have the fabric issues some complained of. The product rolls up and is tied with built in cords. I suspect they'll fail as they seem a little light duty, so I and am adding 3/4" nylon straps for long-term use...or may get a stuff bag.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Brammer

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and cozy!
customer_reviews.text: Based on our first use, these bags were great! It was a rainy, cold night (40f) but we stayed cozy. I also love the roominess, most bags make me feel smothered. I think you would be hard-pressed to find a better bag at this price. If I'm listing any cons it would be that these bags are bulky, but I didn't buy them for backpacking. Part of the zipper looks plastic and I worry about longevity, but it seemed to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Gaige

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this sleeping bag for almost a year now and it still looks great. My daughter's used it on sleepovers and at camp during the summer. We live in the deep South so we were looking for a bag that was comfortable, but not sweltering. The inner lining is a softer, absorbent material which is nice and snuggly. I do wish it came with a bag to store it in, but that's pretty much our only complaint. I'm not sure how it would work for very tall individuals, but she's on the short to average side and has plenty of room while sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Eohany

customer_reviews.title: these are really big, i bought two to form ...
customer_reviews.text: these are really big, i bought two to form one big one to fit two people, and it's actually way too much extra space for us. They also take up a lot of storage room. I wish i had spent more for thinner sleeping bags
customer_reviews.author: Eliza G.

customer_reviews.title: You need a blanket or two.. Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for Outdoor school and my child froze! This is good for summer camping where the weather doesnt drop below 65. I say this because they were in a semi heated cabin. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JR Foster

customer_reviews.title: Its Big and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I used this for camping in June upstate New York. It is really nice to have the extra room. i could squeeze my girlfriend in with me if I wanted. It is well made and the zipper is outstanding. Something to think about when getting a sleeping bag is definitely how annoying the zipper is going to be. I like the headrest for the pillow, it makes it so that the pillow doesnt slide away on you. Great cool weather sleeping bag. Nice and warm when it got chilly at night.
customer_reviews.author: Man Who Only Shops Online

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great construction. The zipper has a 'shovel' type thing on the front to move fabric out of the way. It can still snag but is far less likely. I live in Florida so I don't need anything sub zero. But if the temperature dropped into the 30's I could use this. I would need layers but it would still work fine. The interior texture is very soft and feels nice to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: ____Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Thick, but not very warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these sleeping bags for my husband and myself for an early June camping trip in early June. I thought we might even be a little warm in these since they're for 30-50 degree weather, but the weekend ended up being chilly, surprisingly. It was about 50 when we woke up in the morning and had to have been somewhere in the 40s over night. I woke up FREEZING. While these sleeping bags are nice and thick (and comfortable), I question that they're really made for 30-50 degree weather. I can't imagine if it had been 30 degrees. I wore pants and a sweat shirt to bed and was still cold at 50.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Comfy and high quality zipper. I have had one for about 7 years and just purchased a second. Good quality and soft.
customer_reviews.author: mcragun

customer_reviews.title: Claims it fis up to 6'4". More like 6'.
customer_reviews.text: With my feet jammed into the end, my shoulders are popping out. I'm not sure what Coleman considers a "fit", but I'll have to bring along an extra blanket to cover the rest of me this weekend, or keep my legs bent while I sleep. Too late to return since the camping trip is tomorrow as I write this review, but I guess I'll keep it as a spare sleeping bag and look for something that fits properly before my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and warm
customer_reviews.text: I'm a plus sized guy and I have plenty of room to move around without feeling lost inside. The string to keep it wrapped up is easy enough to operate but I'll definitely be looking for a compression sack to keep the bag wrapped up in an easier to manage bundle.
customer_reviews.author: MarkE

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable bag
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice heavyweight (for Florida) sleeping bag with a soft liner, and this fit the bill. The weather I used it in dipped WELL below what it was rated for, and while it wasn't the most comfortable night's sleep, it kept me from trekking back to the warmth of my truck for the night. In retrospect, I should have packed a lighter bag to 'layer' with this one for my particular excursion. If operating in the recommended temperature range, I cannot imagine a more comfortable bag. Highly recommended! Happy camping!
customer_reviews.author: B. Raposa

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to being as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'5" & 275 lbs. I read other reviews about the bag being shorter than advertised and thought that maybe there were multiple models so I changed it and ordered anyway. I couldn't be more disappointed. The bag measures 78" to the top of the hood, meaning there is nothing above it. I have no idea how they can claim this bag is 84". Also, the material inside is very rough, and not at alI what I expected. This is going back and I'll try again with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty comfy- but not good for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Like all on the other reviews the bag is pretty cozy. Plenty of room to wiggle around. Dried pretty well also after getting wet. Only problem I find is that it rolls up pretty big. I haven't been able to get it as small as it was before I unwrapped it. Maybe I am just doing something wrong :(. It ends up taking a lot of space in the trunk and I don't see how I could ever fly anywhere with it. I might have to buy a smaller one for any out of state travel. Also, I did like that it opens up like a blanket!
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Summertime Sleeping Bag.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, delivered quickly with zero drama. Hope to buy from you again some day. I am 5' 7" tall. Any taller, and this bag, which is well constructed and comfortable, would not be long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Rhoton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Really great bag. It will last for years. I have it a three because of how difficult it is to manage the roll-up and tie feature. I still have no figured this out.
customer_reviews.author: Ctrsi28

customer_reviews.title: the only thing like it because its really big
customer_reviews.text: the only thing like it because its really big, I think it is enough for my BF and me. However, it is not convenient to fold and pack up after open. and the material of inside is not feel comfortable. I recommend it if someone want to buy a big sleeping bag ...
customer_reviews.author: rikoooo

customer_reviews.title: Best thing Ive ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I bought this for a camping trip and didnt expect to use it ever again and now I use it every year for various work events that deal with camping or sleeping in places with no beds! Super cushiony and keeps me toasty on cold nights!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Others didn't like the feel of the inside but for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried this yet but my initial assessment is ok. I knew the bag was going to be big and bulky but it is much more so than expected. It doesn't come with a bag, so I ended up buying a XL compression bag by ALPS. As for the bag itself, it is large and comfy. Others didn't like the feel of the inside but for the cost, I think its good. The best part of this bag is the zipper, it slides very well. I got it for $42 and it think it's worth so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag, great price
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to have the pillow on the sleeping bag without having the bag over your head; I went camping and it got down to 30 degrees, but the bags were still very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sleeping bag crappy packing system
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and loved it. Perfect size, perfect amount of insulation for spring fall camping. Only one question what idiot designed and what bigger idiot approved packing system on this bag. You get good quality sleeping bag and for packing it you get 2 thin ropes, one with a little crappy plastic hook to hold it together once you roll it up for packing. Why o why. I own 4 yes 4 sleeping bags, there are belts, rubber bands, thick ropes paking systems but this one. Honestly one small detail ruining perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big and roomy
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I are big, and so are these sleeping bags. We checked the size to make sure we would fit in them comfortably, and we do. They will get their first test next month so I don't know how well they will hold up, but they are COleman so I assume the quality is there. Make sure you check the temperature rating; these are not cold weather bags.
customer_reviews.author: TomKattt

customer_reviews.title: Great big sleeping bag and the price is right
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag, especially for the price! It's massive - your husband will definitely fit in it. I ended up buying another. Only downside is the material. It's rougher than flannel, but it does the job! Keeps you warm and is not uncomfortable. I heard you can connect two together, too, so I'll be trying that soon
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Cold feet, otherwise nice
customer_reviews.text: Used this all summer. The bag is comfortable, packs down fine for car camping and soft inside which I like. However if you are in under 50 degrees and tend to get cold feet at all, you will need some help in the feet department. I finally stuffed a fleece blanket down in the feet area on my last trip and that helped - socks didn't cut it. Nights tend to be 40-50 camping in the Northwest - sometimes colder. I do also wear a sweatshirt as I get cold if I don't. I'm thinking of a down bag for next year. In warmer climates, this is a nice bag though.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t seem new to me
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the sleeping bag is great, but it came in a box that had clearly been opened before. Also the sleeping bag itself was saran wrapped as if been used before. There were also small dust particles all over the sleeping bag. I know I purchased a new one. Did this happen to anyone else?
customer_reviews.author: Mayurkumar Joshi

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is what we were looking for. finally found one that did all we wanted. warm enough, soft enough.
customer_reviews.author: bozzi1200

customer_reviews.title: This is very wide, and I got it because ...
customer_reviews.text: This is very wide, and I got it because I thought my son might want to sleep with me when we were camping alone. He did not, so the extra space created additional air pockets and I froze (high 30s outside that night)! Comfy bag, but it is wide!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie O

customer_reviews.title: GoidBalue better suited for 6’0” or less in height
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Nice and wide. Better fit for 6’0” or shorter person. If taller the top cover would not cover your shoulders very well. Still good value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for plus sized people.
customer_reviews.text: The best sleeping bag I've ever owned. 5'6"-240 with PLENTY of room to spare. I've only been down to 40° with it and was very comfortable. The extended pillow area is pure genius. It does not come with a storage bag but has double elastic loops to hold it when rolled up. I will likely get a compression pack for it.
customer_reviews.author: HackPJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice and cozy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these. These are perfect for our needs. The ones I received are not light gray as in the pictures but are a really pretty dark grey which I prefer. The lining felt a little stiff at first but after sleeping in them a couple of nights they became soft and cozy, kinda fuzzy like flannel. I definitely recommend them. I am 5'6" and love that these are longer, I can stretch out and not have my feet cramped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon prime customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sleeping Bag! My Son is Thrilled!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my adult son, who is 6ft. 2 & I was worried about the length because of another review on here. He said its plenty long, & wide, & roomy! He is particular about everything, but said this was great quality & he just loves it. Both my two sons are going on a camping trip in June, and my oldest really needed a new sleeping bag. So glad my choice was a great surprise! I may get another one later for my hubby. I recommend this one highly if your tall, & want a roomy sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoma Lady

customer_reviews.title: Big and warm
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally purchased this BIG And TALL sleeping bag for my 9 year old. Oops! She loved that she could fit a friend in the bag! She said it was warm on a 49 degree night. It is massive, so it will not fit in our washer, so plan to wash at a laundry facility.
customer_reviews.author: D. Todd Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Snug a a bug
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big guy and I fit in this with spare room and the lining kept me from getting too hot.
customer_reviews.author: geoff Treibley

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and roomy
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'2" and fit comfortably in this bag. I have to wear thicker clothes to sleep in when the temperature falls below 42 degrees, but I don't get overly warm on warmer nights. It is lightweight and folds well for car/motorcycle camping, but it would not be adequate for overnight hiking. The scoop is a plus, but definitely not essential. If I outlast this bag, I will purchase another just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: so you can choose the cooler over the warmer if you like. Very little shifting when sleeping and it has ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a hell of a sleeping bag. It compares to those $100+ models out there. It really keeps in the heat. The inside is a more felty flannel and the outside is the water proof stuff. You can reverse the bag, so you can choose the cooler over the warmer if you like. Very little shifting when sleeping and it has a great sturdy zipper. Best part is, it wraps up nicely. There's a strap and hook that isn't very complicated to use.
customer_reviews.author: HungryHippo

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like an American made product that works well. I only have used it four times in light camping and it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: j. headley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Went on a cool weather boyscout camp out and the temperatures at night were in the 30's. I couldn't believe I stayed warm. In fact at one point in the middle of the night I got too hot! Had to unzip and let some cool air in. Nice and soft. You might as well order a bag to keep it in though. Really hard to get the flimsy cords to hold it together when you roll the bag up. But I can live with that for the price and the warmth it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is good enough for sleep over parties. Not a whole lot of room to move around in tho. Quality is good and keeps me warm.
customer_reviews.author: Jhonny Y.

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved
customer_reviews.text: I never thought a sleeping bag could be THIS COMFORTABLE. I needed a bigger sleeping bag because I like the extra room and also my tiny dog insists on sleeping in it with me. She loves it so much that sometimes I can't get her out of it in the mornings.
customer_reviews.author: MBrainspaz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping. Super comfy and great for tall people.
customer_reviews.author: Hopena Kahakui

customer_reviews.title: The pillow area is very large and comfortable. These are very rooming width wise
customer_reviews.text: I never zipped it up in 50 degree weather. The fabric was not cold when first climbing in. The pillow area is very large and comfortable. These are very rooming width wise. I am 5'11" and thought the length would have been on the short side for anyone who was 6ft or taller. Overall great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this sleeping bag! The only issue I had is that the string broke the first time I used it. I did try to carry it with the string and that's what made it snap but I believe they could've made it of higher quality (that is the string, I'm talking about). Other than that, it's really nice, I love how big it is, I can actually move around in it.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Baral

customer_reviews.title: Good basic sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I wasn't cramped (like I am in my mummy bag) and it has plenty of room. Seemed warm enough too, although I got it to use when we went to a cabin for a friend's bachelorette party. So, it hasn't been tested in actual camping-type circumstances (nor is it likely to be). One thing I will note, it has kind of a funny plasticky smell when I first got it. I spread it out on the bed in my guest room for a week before our trip and that seemed to help.
customer_reviews.author: RainyInPdx

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sleeping Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I used this sleeping bag recently on a weekend camping trip in the ADK / Northeast. The temps got down into the 40's at night and it get kept me very warm. The zippers and bag seem well made. The materials are not luxurious but are good for the price point. Also, it fit my large frame comfortably. I have 52 shoulders and am about 6ft tall with a stocky build, and I had room to move around in it. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: THIS IS SPARTA !!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag worked out great! We have used it a lot and keep using it for actual camping as well as sleepovers at friends houses. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. B.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Smelled pretty strongly of factory smells upon arrival. I threw it over the shower curtain rod for a day or two and the smells dissipated. After that, Amazing!!! I've slept in it about a week all together so far. Soft on the inside, nice on the outside. Good colors, good temperature, good no-snag zipper closure. Very good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Yelske

customer_reviews.title: I like the extra room the large size gives you
customer_reviews.text: I like the extra room the large size gives you. Very comfortable, liner is soft. I recently went camping and the weather got down to the 40's. In the past, I have used a comforter and stayed cold. This kept me nice and toasty. I like the clip that is attached, makes it easy to roll up and keep it that way.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Bag, Just keep in mind...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great sleeping bag. Just keep in mind that it is LARGE as described, which means unless you're pretty big build, it's not going to be very snug and fit to your body. This also means less warmth retained in the bag (if you aren't a big guy/girl). But then again, it's very spacious! Also, and this has been pointed out already by other reviews, it's not a back-packing sleeping bag. It's quite heavy (and large). It also doesn't seem quite as long as described. Still long though.
customer_reviews.author: Vidura

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: What an excellent bag for the price. Comfortable. Zipper is smooth, whether your zip perking it from the outside or inside. The lip that extends under your head is great. Keeps my pillow off the floor. It keeps you warm when it's cool and it doesn't toast you when it's warm out. A little cumbersome when rolling it up for storage but it's a minor inconvenience. Overall an excellent bag for camping or when you have a guest over.
customer_reviews.author: HarlemKnightz

customer_reviews.title: We found the inside comfortable and the lining was slick and soft
customer_reviews.text: We used 2 of these on a recent trip in 30-50 degree weather. We found the inside comfortable and the lining was slick and soft. We used them unzipped as a top and bottom in 30 degree weather but we still needed 2 blankets to stay warm. By the end of the trip we zipped the two of them together and this seems like a more efficient system. The bags do not come with a compression sack and are quite large even when rolled and tied. we found no cons with them so far
customer_reviews.author: B. Hettel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a scrapbook retreat at a camp (think rustic) and served as my bedding quite comfortably. I am not a small person and this bag was absolutely perfect! I was well covered, warm without being overheated and enough room to turn over without getting tangled up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Szabo

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not the most packable sleeping bag, but makes up for that in comfort. I love the extra room near the head. Was great for sleeping in the woods for a week with temperatures between 45 and 70 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Leah B.

customer_reviews.title: Most definitely a great investment. I went out in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Most definitely a great investment. I went out in cold weather, camping in the mountains and every time the coldness got to me I reached for my sleeping bag just like a ​regular blanket. This was possible by the easy durable zipper that allows one to open out the bag or close as necessary. The quality of the material both inside and out is great and easy to clean which was one of my main concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Matterson Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great product ...... just outside is brown... not silver
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with color .. photo appears silver or original duct tape color... but is actually brown. That being said... this is a great affordable roomy sleeping bag. Can also be opened all the way to use as a blanket. The zipper is FANTASTIC !!!!! Does not get hung up !!! They should make zippers the same way in purses, messenger bags, back packs ... jackets... EVERYTHING !!!! I definitely recommend this item... the temperatures given are VERY accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Bama

customer_reviews.title: This one is perfect for cooler
customer_reviews.text: We live in Arizona, so most sleeping bags leave us overheated when we use them. This one is perfect for cooler, but not cold camping. It's bigger than normal sleeping bags as well, so I can roll over without feeling like I'm trapped in the bag. It can be unzipped and opened up for use on a bigger sleeping area, but I've mostly used it on a cot. It's very comfortable and easy to pack up.
customer_reviews.author: Team Tiny Limbs

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: I'm a skinny guy but like the large size of this bag. I feel like I can't spread out enough in a normal bag. Wouldn't backpack with this but it is perfect for the campground camping we usually do. Temperature has been down to 45F with me sleeping in shorts and t-shirt and was extremely comfortable. Only thing I would change is how the bag is longer on one side to accommodate a pillow. This makes it so you can't flip your bag over if you want the zipper to open on the other side depending on where you are in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: hairytoes

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, cozy, warm
customer_reviews.text: Kept me cozy one night at 40 degrees and the next night at 60 I slept on top of it for an extra cushioning base. I Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sage-pants

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for tall people
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent to taking on a family camping trip. I have a 17 year old son that is over 6 feet tall and I was concerned a regular sleeping bag would be way too small. This sleeping bag was perfect for him. The material is comfortable and high quality. Exactly what I expected from a Coleman product.
customer_reviews.author: Mina Vulpis

customer_reviews.title: A lot of room and warmth
customer_reviews.text: I am a average sized woman of 5'5 and I got this sleeping bag for my camping trip I knew would be chilly (30s-50s at night) and it worked perfectly and kept me very warm. I got the larger size because I like to sleep on my stomach with my knee off to the side a bit and wanted wiggle room. This worked perfectly for that. It is a little large to store rolled up, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Extra room was much needed!
customer_reviews.text: Cozy without being restrictive. I stayed a perfect temperature all night though I was in a beach cabin. I choose this one for the extra room and it absolutely fit the bill! I have to use pillows between my knees. I was able to do this easily and still had room to move about. The pillow type extension was very nice. This bag is bulky but light. Bulk made for a more cushy feel. Note I am 5'6", 155 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: SAG

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a big camper
customer_reviews.text: I'm not hardcore campy. This is soft and cozy and worked well for our outing with the kids, warm and soft enough, etc. I like the lip that sticks out for your head. The interior is just soft, regular type cotton, not the thin fleece I had as a child that seemed to wear through over time. The interior will wear well and become cozier over time, so I'm content with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Analise

customer_reviews.title: Solid sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a recent camping trip, we stayed in a cabin though and the weather was unseasonably warm, I was sweating in it the second night. It is a big sleeping bag width wise but length was great (I'm only 5'8") interior lining wasn't the softest but it was comfortable enough, the flashlight pocket fit my energizer headlamp perfectly so that was convenient and I like the colors, no issue with the zippers at all, it is tough to roll really tight and the strings aren't the best, I recommend a compression sack (get a larger one or it won't fit in a small one) That is all...
customer_reviews.author: A B

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bag for the price and for my purposes. I need a sleeping bag to take to friends' houses with me, along with my air mattress . I can not sleep on a regular bed and have an air mattress at home. Solves two problems. 1) my hostess doesn't have to do a pile of sheets and laundry when I leave, and 2) it's perfectly comfortable and fits on top of the air mattress perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Northern latitude

product_meta.title: Coleman White Water Adult Sleeping Bag, Big & Tall
product_meta.description:
Sleep comfortably in temperatures as low as 30°F with the Coleman White Water Sleeping Bag. Intended for people up to 5 feet 11 inches tall, this extra-wide camping sleeping bag offers plenty of wiggle room and features an extended contoured top to keep your head off the cold ground. Featuring a brushed polyester cover, a cozy liner, and a ComfortCuff that surrounds your face in soft, warm fabric, this sleeping bag helps you sleep well in the great outdoors. On warmer nights, open the 2-way zipper to ventilate the bag. On colder nights, zip the bag up completely to keep yourself warm. The Thermolock draft tube helps prevent heat loss through the zipper. Plus, the patented ZipPlow system plows fabric away from the zipper to prevent snags and frustration. Thanks to its Roll Control design and Quick Cord patented no-tie closure, this backpacking sleeping bag is easy for one person to pack without assistance and is machine washable for easy cleaning.

AMAZON.COM


Ideal for cool weather camping where the temperature range is between 30 and 50 degrees Fahrenheit, the Coleman White Water large sleeping bag is durably constructed of a polyester cover with soft, cozy cotton-flannel tricot lining. Four pounds of ColeTherm insulation keep you comfortable throughout the night, and the oversized bag measures 39-by-84 inches (W x D), fitting taller campers up to five feet, eleven inches tall. 

 A unique scoop shape creates a comfortable headrest, keeping your head and pillow off the ground, while QuickCord storage means fast, tie-free closure of the sleeping bag when it's time to strike camp. 

 The White Water sleeping bag includes Coleman's ComfortSmart technology, meaning it's full of features to keep you warm and comfortable, such as: 

 * ZipPlow: Prevents zipper snags by plowing fabric away from zipper 
 * Roll Control: Locks bag in place for easier rolling
 * FiberLock: Prevents insulation from shifting, increasing durability
 * ThermoLock: Reduces heat loss through the zipper, keeping you warmer 
 * Certified Temperature Rating: Independently tested for temperature accuracy 
 * Zipper Glide Tailoring: Allows smooth zipper operation around the corner 
 * Comfort Cuff: Surrounds your face with softness



 The Coleman Limited Warranty
Coleman has been in business for more than 100 years, and continues to produce high-quality, affordable tents, lanterns, table-top stoves, and more. All Coleman products have a warranty against defects in material and workmanship, and the White Water sleeping bag includes a limited five-year manufacturer's warranty. 

 About Coleman Outdoor Products
More than 100 years ago, an entrepreneurial young man named W.C. Coleman had an idea for manufacturing better lanterns in Wichita, Kansas. A century later, Coleman's current catalog features a wide-ranging array of products that make spending time outside a pleasure. The company crafts coolers that keep food and drinks cold for days, airbeds that are comfortable and won't deflate during the night, a complete line of bright and long-lasting LED lights, powerful portable grills that cook with an authentic open-grill flame, and more.
feature_bullets: Adult sleeping bag for camping in temperatures as low as 30 degrees Fahrenheit
Can accommodate most people up to 5 feet 11 inches tall
Brushed polyester cover, cozy liner, and ComfortCuff provide softness and warmth
ZipPlow system plows away fabric to prevent snagging during zipping
Roll Control design and patented no-tie closure for easy one-person packing

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
